dialogues.text: Maybe now's the time to reach out to him. She hands him her cell phone. Colter just holds it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my dad, we don't see eye to eye. We're just two different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As opposed to being the exact same person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always this sarcastic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so not about me. Colter reluctantly dials. As it rings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June 11th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: June? One more thing to puzzle him. The call connects. An OLDER MAN, DONALD STEVENS, answers. The gravelly voice of a Midwestern farmer.

dialogues.speaker: DONALD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? Donald doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, it's me. It's Colter. Again, silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a while, huh? I'd been meaning to call you, but -- Click. The line goes dead. Colter looks at Christina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted me to stay on and take over the farm but... I had other ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're intimidated by him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scared of him. I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I am. Challenged, he redials. Braced for conflict. The call connects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, don't hang up. We're going to talk. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me. Whoever you are, never call here again. Donald hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still mad at you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... it was like he didn't even know who I was. Troubled, he hands back her phone. Outside, the EXPRESS TRAIN flashes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to help you. She feels bad for him. And something inside Colter closes Retreating inside himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to have bothered you. He gets up to go. Christina stays where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in his seat. Lost in the view out the window. The neighborhoods have given way to Newark's industrial fring Bringing him closer to the inevitable end.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have a friend. Surprised, he turns to find her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She works at the New York Times. Her name's Stephanie. She's just a proofreader, but she wants to be made a reporter. She's always saying she needs a good story to bring in so she gets noticed. Something like this, with a crazy paranoid angle could really interest her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could do some poking around. She's already quite suspicious of the government. Christina's dialing her phone. Colter turns back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting voice mail. (into the phone) Steph, it's Christina. You know that story you're always looking to write? I might just have something for you. I met a guy. His name is Colter Stevens. He says he's in the army. He flies helicopters in Iraq, but now they've put him into a secret project called Source Code. Maybe you can look into it a bit, okay? Call me. She hangs up. Pleased with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll call back. Just wait. None of it will do Colter any good, but he manages a smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am? How old do you think I am? He gives her a wary look. Considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five? She smiles, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you mean, there's a criminal on the train? How do you know that? Colter looks away. Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you if you don't tell me everything about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter enters the tiny space. Christina is reluctant to follow him into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just tell me? He gives her an imploring look. She sighs and squeezes in next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try anything and I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the door. As she shuts the door, Colter gets up on the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He wrenches back the ventilation panel, then steps aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up here. He holds out his hand. She grabs hold and steps up on the sink. She's not quite tall enough to see into the crawlspace, so he steps up behind her and lifts her the r of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled, feels his hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look. Her blouse brushes his face as he holds her up. A long be as she looks inside the overhead space at the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acetone Peroxide. It's a liquid explosive. There's fourteen cannisters of it. Simple detonator. Cell phone signal closes the circuit and boom. He lowers her. An incredulous beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you put this here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was someone else. They don't know who. That's why I'm here. To find out. Watching her. Will she believe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to tell someone. We have to stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens and Christina walks quickly away. Mounting fear. Colter falls into step behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't matter. The train's already...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been sent here. It sounds crazy, but it's true. I've been sent from the future -- from five hours in the future. This train's already been blown up. She backs up. Scared of him. Every right to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to know. Now you know. She turns and hurries for the exit doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening. I've got to get off. Colter catches up with her inside the exit vestibule. She stabbing at the door release button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't it open?! Her phone is RINGS. They both stop. She looks at the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Steph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she'd be interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Her eyes are fixed suspiciously on Colter as she listens. Colter looks outside. Recognizes the terrain. Looks down

dialogues.speaker: SECONDS.
dialogues.text: It's awful. Unbearable. He dashes towards the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears open the door. Jumps up on the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits in the semi-darkness, faintly illuminated by the bathroom's fluorescent light. As he grabs hold of the bom he hears --

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Colter...? Working fast, he unhooks the leads on the detonator, rips away gaffing tape -- jostling the cannisters of explosive

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Colter, I have to tell you something. -- and pulls off the detonator cell phone. Ducking back down, he see Christina standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. Now the fucking thing can't go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reads 20 SECONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie did a computer search. Something in her expression worries him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a database of all newspaper articles going back to forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Source Code's classified. It wouldn't be in a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But you were. She found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She found me? What does that mean? She stops. Not wanting to go on. From outside comes the HORN from the approaching freight train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Christina, are you going to spit it out? In his hand, the CELL PHONE RINGS. Colter's eyes light up amazement -- the DISPLAY SCREEN is showing the name and number of the bomber. But before he can read what's there Christina's voice finds its way to the back of his brain:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the notice, you were killed in action two months ago. The world stops. A SEARING PAIN SLAMS INTO him. He drops the phone and doubles over. She runs to him --

Everything around him PIXELATES into a hundred thousand POINTS on an array. Christina's cries become bursts of static. Flying behind the array come LINES OF COMPUTER CO - the Source Code architecture laid bare. And then the screen itself seems to melt, giving way to a frightening series of HALLUCINATORY FRAGMENTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PILOT'S P.O.V. -- desert sand, searingly bright -- flig deck instrumentation -- a windshield pockmarked with bull holes -- the horizon tilting as the helicopter PLUNGES towards earth amid a chaos of RADIO TRANSMISSIONS: "...taking a lot of RPG fire... be advised A61 is going down... A61 is going down hard..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black smoke. Boots crunching on sand as we are borne, P.O.V., a victim on a jostling stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airborne again. The thud of rotors. Through blurred visio we see medics working furiously to save a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smooth, glassy calm of 30,000 feet. The regular pulsations of a VENTILATOR. Fluids drip down through an I bag. Tubes and monitors stacked all around us. Gurneys of other wounded packed together. The grumble of another, unseen wounded soldier:

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Never any damn leg room on a plane. An ALARM begins beeping.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT MEDIC, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, this guy's crashing... FADE TO BLACK. Silence and darkness. Nothingness.
Then, a PLAYING CARD appears, as if through a slide projector. The Jack of Clubs.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain...? The playing card flickers, separates into pixels, then dissolves.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Goodwin. You're with Beleaguered Castle. You are safe. All your needs will be met here. Lines of computer code flit across the screen. A blinking cursor. FADE TO BLACK. A tiny APERTURE opens... revealing CHRISTINA. And the bicycle. And the stone wall. The strange, recurring visio

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain? The sound drives away the image, replacing it with

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain, just tell me what you see. Just look and speak. Groggy breathing. A ragged voice:

dialogues.speaker: COLTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I see a card.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Very good. Very, very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Colter's face. A deep, cold knot in his stomach. Shuddering in fear. The truth before him now. Crouching there, a nightmare, ruling over him. On the MONITOR, Goodwin looks into the camera. Assessing situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you comfortable? Are you warm? Colter clings to his harness as if to keep from vanishing entirely from existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need to urinate? Colter swallows. Too terrorized to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beleaguered Castle is waiting for your report. Goodwin taps his pen on his clipboard. Impatient. He flip a switch. A blocky COMPUTER VOICE, something out of the 1970s, comes on:

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hearing Test. First sequence. Left ear. A short SERIES of ELECTRONIC TONES.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hearing Test. First sequence. Right ear. The tones cease. Colter remains impassive and inert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I know you can hear me. Did you find the bomber? Goodwin keys in some commands. Forever adjusting.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Memory Thread One: "When Lily woke, she had the bed to herself. She sat up, bewildered by the strangeness of her surroundings; then memory returned, and she looked about her with a shiver." Goodwin stops the audio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you're collecting your thoughts, I should tell you there's been another development. A terrorist group has taken responsibility for bombing the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This began broadcasting over the Internet a half hour. We've traced it to central Asia.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: A grainy VIDEO shows an arid, wind-swept plateau of a far away desert. It is twilight. A MUJAHIDEEN FIGHTER, his fa hidden by a hooded cloak, sits cross legged before a flickering camp fire and a tea service. The fighter rises, picks up a rocket-propelled grenade launcher, and approaches the camera. The wind whips his black robes. The figure looks slight. Almost spectral. It begins speaking to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on camera, in accented

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now you have suffered a taste of divine vengeance. God willing, you will soon suffer another. Colter does not raise his head. No idea whether he's even listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These attacks will show you that you will never be safe. You can secure your borders. But what can you do against one of your own citizens? One who looks like you, who is blameless, living already among you, who takes eighty million of our dollars, a trifle, and carries out our bidding? You cannot stop this. Time has run out. The image freezes. Then switches back to the live feed of Goodwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to Rutledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've decided to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge. Get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate your desire for further discussion. Perhaps at a later date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you let me out of here? Goodwin ignore the question. Continues making notations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, Captain, we're disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Rutledge! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to say that we expected more from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop reading from your goddamn script!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we overestimated your abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to fucking Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please accept the criticism in the spirit it was given. Perhaps a few memory exercises would help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your criticism and I don't need your memory exercises, you gutless freak. And by the way, that bomb is detonated by a cell phone. When activated, the phone's display screen displays caller ID information. Caller ID. I wonder if that information would be useful to Beleaguered Castle. For a split second, Goodwin looks thrown. But the mask of the cold clinician goes back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. We're ready for that information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to send me back. I didn't get a good look at it. But I will next time. Goodwin hesitates. Skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What assurance do we have you'll be able to read the screen before the device detonates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodwin, there's no time left. Send... me... back. Goodwin's pale, inscrutable face fills the monitor. His e are unblinking. Unfeeling. Nothing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter prowls the aisle feverishly. He scans the overhead luggage rack. Peeks inside a bag. Doesn't see what he wants. He looks all around... up the rows of passengers.. intently scanning... There. The Computer Engineer. He's asleep. But clutched i his hand is what Colter wants -- a CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train jolts slightly, waking him up. Looking down, th Computer Engineer notices that his cell phone has vanishe Across the aisle, a LATINA OFFICE MANAGER taps him on the arm. She gestures down the aisle to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's walking off with the guy's cell phone. Behind him, Computer Engineer gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you have my phone? People turn to look. Among them is Christina. Colter just starts walking faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, give me back my phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Computer Engineer hurries in. Colter is nowhere in sight. He RUNS down the aisle and towards the next car. PAN OVER to the DOOR of the CONDUCTOR'S COMPARTMENT as it CLICKS SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathless, Colter has just finished shutting the door an about to use the cell phone when sees THE CONDUCTOR and a TRAIN OFFICIAL Looking over at him in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Wrong turn. Reversing gears, Colter backs out of the compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the befuddled Computer Engineer disappears into t third car, Colter steps back into the aisle and walks the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating a bit now, Colter is keying in a number on the c phone as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Operator. City and listing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las Vegas, Nevada. Nellis Air Force Base.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Connecting you. A tingle up his spine. The call connects.

dialogues.speaker: POST OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Post Operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this... Nellis Air Force Base?

dialogues.speaker: POST OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. How may I direct your call? He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to reach... Captain Colter Stevens. Calling himself. Strange. No idea where this is going.

dialogues.speaker: POST OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I have no listing for a Captain Colter Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me the Combined Air and Space Ops Center.

dialogues.speaker: POST OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One moment, sir. The call seems to take forever to connect. Then a terse military VOICE comes on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: C Deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: C Deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling for Rutledge. It's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have the wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Colter Stevens. An eerie pause.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Would you repeat that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter Stevens. Captain Colter Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hold the line.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. The train slows at it pulls into Newark Station. Another voice comes over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain? This is Goodwin. Colter's heart sinks.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where are you, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to Rutledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? How did you find us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the train. The train pulls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Newark Station.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know. It hasn't happened yet.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What hasn't happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosion.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What explosion?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All aboard. Doors are closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? I'm in it, Goodwin. I'm calling you from inside the mission. Inside the Source Code. A beat of stunned silence. The train begins moving.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Next stop New York Penn Station.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This contact is ill-advised. I must ask you to hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodwin, I'm trapped in this and I can't get out.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have no authorization to be making this call. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Wait! Don't hang up! Forget authorization. There's no time. Soon you're going to find out what happened on this train. And then your own day is going to start. But not until then. Right now it's just you and me talking. And you're a different Goodwin than the one I'm going to go back to in a few minutes. You're separate from him. Separate worlds. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now there's a lot of secrecy in all of this, and you have your reasons for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here and now, just this once, I need to ask you something. And you need to tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd rather you not ask me anything, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to ask it.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I should terminate this call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Goodwin, how can I get through to you? You're not just a soldier. Somewhere inside you're a human being, too. Somewhere inside you've got to know that this is wrong. Source Code is wrong. And if you can't grasp that, if you just follow orders, then you're just as much a prisoner as I am. The car SHUDDERS as the EXPRESS TRAIN FLASHES BY. Quiet returns as it recedes.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's your question? Surprised, Colter raises his head. Draws a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I survive that helicopter crash in Iraq? Silence. Colter shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me. Did I survive that crash? Another pause. This is crushing Colter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodwin.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not physically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not physically survive the crash. A terrible chill comes over Colter. He swallows. Trying t stay brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not physically? Fuck. At least give me an answer I can understand.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We've kept alive certain areas of your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... the capsule I'm in...

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A manifestation. Your way of making sense of it. This is crushing. Colter fights back terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no right.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As a soldier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a soldier. Then. But now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After death?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the only way. You couldn't have a body and be sent back into the Source Code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the status of your mission? Is it a success?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I suppose not. You're right to keep it from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we do. Keep stuff from each other. Will this ever end?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: End?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I get out of this?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You must realizes the army's made an investment in you. You'll be used again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Imagine a turntable. With a record spinning on it. All we do is lift up the needle. The music stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then we wait. Until another mission. And the needle comes down again. You won't remember any of this. We'll start with the playing cards. Electronic tones. Simple memory exercises. Bit by bit, we'll revive your cerebral capacities once more. The barbarism of it. Digital slavery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times have I done this?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one knows I'm here. No one can help me.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In stimulating your cortex, they're prolonging your life. Many soldiers would find that preferable to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this. I served my country. I already gave my life.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The courts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The courts know you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Military court or civilian court?

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Military. Colter finds no comfort in this.

dialogues.speaker: GOODWIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you found out about all of this. That wasn't our intention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that make it any less wrong? No answer. Colter looks down at his watch. Time is runnin out. And there's absolutely nothing he can do.

dialogues.speaker: COLTER'S FACE
dialogues.text: Ashen. Almost lifeless. Around him is the darkened steel cocoon of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its appearance has altered slightly, given Colter's new awareness of what this really is. The capsule is even mor claustrophobic. There are fewer controls. Even less light A shadow world. The monitor is blank. He shouts from the void --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodwin?! Rutledge appears. Drops into the seat and puts on the headset. Fiddles with his pipe as a way to avoid looking the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going? Any breakthroughs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally get it, Rutledge. You're the good guy, Goodwin's the bad guy. Working together, you get what you want out of me. Why didn't I see it before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, Captain, I'm on your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it. I know about the helicopter crash. I know what they've done with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's been a long day. For all of us. But now we've got to bring this home and catch a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. These guys are serious. Help me out. My ass is on the line, too, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do better than that. They sent you here to offer me a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I'm enjoying this, you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's their offer? What can they possibly threaten me with after so colossally fucking me? Spit it out, you spineless turd. Rutledge's face goes red. Quite possibly no one has ever spoken to him like this before. After a sputtering pause, Rutledge's mouth hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government can decide to take an interest in people. People like your father with his struggling farm. It can discover things like unpaid property taxes. It can call in his equipment loans or tie him down for years in environmental litigation. On the other hand, it can pay him handsomely for mineral deposits he never knew were there. As distant and problematic as your relationship was, surely you'd like the chance to do something for him. A beat of silent outrage from Colter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those after images I saw. You never knew about them. They weren't part of Source Code architecture, were they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're meaningless. Nerves firing. Brain chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe that. I've been to places you haven't. I've crossed and recrossed that line between living and dying. And when I do, that veil gets lifted for just a second. And what's there is real. Maybe it's a vision of the next world, but I can see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see it. But you can never get there without our help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get there? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our offer. Maybe we can get you there. In return for your completing the mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll let you die. I'll shut off your life support and you'll simply slip away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the good Lord intended you to do a few months back. A fearful beat. Negotiating over his own soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd never do it. You wouldn't have to. You could just flip the switch and start me back up again unaware. For all I know, you've made this deal with me before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, we haven't. Your operational awareness has become too great. If you found out the truth about yourself once, you might do so again. As for Source Code, I'm sure we can find other servicemen coming back from overseas with wounds just like yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the courage to serve your country one final time? Colter's eyes bore into Rutledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find you, Rutledge. Someday. Somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (retreating from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display screen on the detonator was a useful and exciting insight you made. This time, make it pay off. Get the information on the screen. But let the bomb explode. We need the force of the explosion to help integrate you quickly back into the present. The Source Code machinery is already beginning to HUM. Rutledge excitedly keying in system commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? Somehow, I'm going to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that.

There's barely time for Colter to grab onto the harness restraints before the machinery goes into a deafening HOW THUNK. Colter's body convulses and goes limp. Unconscious, he sa in his seat, held in by the harness. Everything SWITCHES AND GOES DARK. A split second later, the capsule comes back to life agai As if the plug were simply put back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain? Colter JOLTS AWAKE. Disoriented. Thrashing to get free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Calm yourself. You're back. Colter exhales. Shuddering. He's just completed another Source Code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? The tentacles of the nightmare slowly releasing. Replaced the oppression of being back in the capsule. Back in Rutledge's power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the bomber's identity on the cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. But there wasn't time to read the screen. As soon as it rang the bomb went off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the phone itself? Make, model, product identification number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was unable examine the phone without separating it from the detonator -- which I was instructed not to do. His delivery is different now. Impersonal. Distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you make any other progress? What in heck's name did you do for those seventeen minutes? Colter does not answer. The machinery again STARTS UP. Colter tenses, bewildered. Eyes dart accusingly to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What are you -- THUNK. Again, he convulses and goes limp. Click. Darkness. Everything POWERS DOWN... ... And BACK UP again -- controls, monitor, machinery. Colter GROANS and opens his eyes. Gripped by another terr Returning from yet another trip on the train. Another bom blast. Death and resurrection. Rutledge looks in on him with impatience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do this all day. Until you get it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I don't feel good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't doubt it. Who's the bomber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I honestly... I can't keep... The HUMMING again. He's helpless. An insect on a pin. Colter tears at his restraints, ready to bash his brains against the controls. He SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and, in sudden freedom, surges up out of his seat wit cry. Around him startled passengers look over in confusio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!
Colter, back in his navy jacket, slacks and shirt, has pitched forward into Christina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get off me? The Overweight Man, wide eyed in surprise, has his finger poised to open his can of soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead! Open your fucking soda! CHK-THOCK! The Overweight Man complies. Some half-muttere reproaches, then most people go back to what they were do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you, anyway? She glares at him at he stands up. He can't respond. Despair surges through him. He stumbles off down the aisl But where can he go? There is no freedom. No escape. Imprisoned in both worlds. From her seat, Christina watches him go. Sensing the torm in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter is slumped in a corner. Christina appears. Taps hi on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? He eyes her furtively. Like a cave man who's never seen another human being before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not okay. He's ghastly pale. He's sweating profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, please... return to your seat. Footsteps. The sound of jangling KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket.
The conductor takes up position in front of him. As implacable as Rutledge, in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still needs a ticket. Colter makes no move to respond. No more concern for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have it your way, pal. He takes out his book to write Colter up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I'll pay it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea where he got on. Full fare's $22.50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Getting out her wallet, she pays the conductor. He eyes h with disapproval, then shambles off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see customer service is alive and well on New Jersey Transit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you just do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ticket? I don't know. You looked a little lost. The gratitude in his look makes her self conscious. She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do me a favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Just get off the train. Her puzzled look. The train begins to SLOW DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't my stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have been on this train, Christina. You should be living another life. Not spending it answering phones for lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you...? A group of passengers approaches the exit area. We've see them all before: Derek, the Old Man, the College Kid. And the small encounters: shuffling around, positioning at th doors, and the College Kid tapping Derek on the arm, hold out Derek's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you dropped this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved, takes it back) Wow. Thanks. The train stops. The doors OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Newark Station. Derek, the Old Man and the College Kid get off. A second later, Guzman bursts past them, making his nauseated run the station. Leaving just Colter and Christina there. The doors stand open, invitingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has a destiny. And this isn't yours. He steps out onto the platform. Holds out his hand for he to join him. A coaxing look. She's incredulous. This guy. His words. This whole moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who in the world are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. Stop being afraid. Believe in yourself. He waits for her. Only two steps away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All aboard. Doors are closing. She blinks. The spell breaks. Those two steps prove to be two much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. She retreats back into the car. Colter is heartbroken. About to pursue her, he happens to look over and see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of going directly to the station house, Derek continues walking down the platform alongside the train, if intending to reboard further down. And then it happens. With a quick motion Derek TOSSES SOMETHING through an ope door of another car, then heads quickly away towards the station house. With no time to think, Colter slips back on board just as doors slide shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train begins moving. Christina is nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is a New York bound train. Next stop New York - Penn Station.
Intrigued, Colter leaves the exit door area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Strides down the aisle of the second car... and reach the next set of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing there. Whatever Derek tossed inside is go Did someone pick it up? Colter looks up the aisle and the the other way into the next car. No one there. Once more he examines the exit area. Gets down on his kne Then he spots it -- an OPENING between the floor and one the wall panels, only a few inches high. And there something lies. Colter slides it out. Derek's WALLET. Intentionally left here. The same wallet the College Kid gave back to Derek earlier. Opening it, Colter pulls out Derek's DRIVER'S LICENSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Source Code has finished. The monitor shows just the empty chair. Finally Rutledge returns to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've searched the wreckage and found the wallet. It was under the wall panel. Just as you said. An awkward dynamic between them. They despise each other have to work together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, he's our guy. He tossed his own wallet back on the train. Only reason he'd do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing his thought) ...is if he wanted us to think he died in the explosion. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We looked into his profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek Frost is a commodities trader, with a wife, two children and a promotion one month old. He's an emergency preparedness volunteer on his office floor, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw that terrorist video -- they said it was one of us. One of our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's really the one, you can find out the rest of his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By any means necessary. There is no Geneva Convention in the Source Code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torture him, you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out the plan, before it happens here. And then I'll let you die. Their grisly bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the conductor's compartment there's a fully loaded 9 millimeter handgun locked in a safe. Think you can remember the combination?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina is absorbed in her sketch book. Across from her Colter watches. A stranger to her again. It hurts too muc She feels his eyes on her. When she looks up, he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Guzman exits the bathroom, he almost crashes into Colt who's waiting right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assalam'alaikoom. Squeezing past, Guzman does a double take to hear the standard Arabic reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching into the overhead crawl space, Colter once again unhooks the cell phone detonator from the bomb. Sitting down on the toilet seat, he dials 4-1-1 on the ce phone.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What listing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina's CELL PHONE RINGS. She gets it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Christina? It's Stephanie. Where are you right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to work. Why?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The strangest thing. The phone rang at my desk and some guy I don't know said the train you're on isn't safe and that you should get off at the next stop. Then he hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? The train begins to SLOW DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe you should get off. Are you okay? The station platform slides into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Everything's normal. Is there something on the news? Some kind of alert?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nothing that I've heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls to a stop. Passengers begin to get off.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Newark Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina is out of her seat, debating.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think you should get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be late for work.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The hell with work, Christina! You hate that job anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably a joke. A weirdo guy from somewhere. She sees Colter down in the exit area. They lock eyes. And somehow she knows. He made the call. Colter quickly disappears into the other car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors stand open to the platform. Just then Derek's WALLET goes skidding back on board, disappearing under th wall panel. A second later, Colter reaches the exit area.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All aboard. Doors are closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train doors shut. Colter is now out on the platform. Christina is not there. Concerned, walking quickly forwar Colter looks through the windows... And finds her staring back at him. Still on the train. A strange moment between the two of them. Once again he's failed to save her. They watch each other for as long as possible, until the train pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train SPEEDS UP, Christina sits down again, loweri her phone.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Did you get off...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll call you back. She hangs up. Disturbed. As if she's failed some test. But what test? Why this weird feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is a New York bound train. Next stop New York - Penn Station. The train SPEEDS UP. Anxiety creeps into her face. Lookin around, the tranquility of the passengers begins to seem ominous, hinting that she's made the wrong choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conductor enters. About to pour himself a cup of coff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? The metal door to THE SAFE has been OPENED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the quiet lobby, Derek is heading for the outer do to the parking lot, when:

dialogues.speaker: COLTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Derek Frost. Colter is walking towards him, holding up Derek's WALLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forget something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh. Is that my wallet? As he goes to take it, Colter GRABS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the closed door at the end stall comes the sound o GUZMAN VOMITING. BANG - The men's room DOOR flies open -- Colter DRAGS Der inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, man? What the hell???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this? Colter pulls out the DETONATOR CELL PHONE -- the one he t off the bomb. Holds it inches from Derek's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you can't blow it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Get away from me! The BARREL of a 9 MM PISTOL. Aimed right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I'm very accurate with one of these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Derek raises his hands. Sweating. All fright. Like a decent man, terrorized. It gives Colter pause. Does he have the right guy? A toilet FLUSHES. The last stall door opens and Guzman emerges. Stops cold as Colter swings the pistol at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay there, my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop acting, for Chrissakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep my wallet. Take my watch. Take anything you want. Unprompted, Guzman takes out his own wallet and sets it o the counter. Calmer than Derek. Accustomed to trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Now you have two wallets. Take them and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Tensing. This isn't supposed to happen like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I have a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those other passengers? Don't you think they had families?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man's a terrorist. He planted a bomb on the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Click. Colter pulls back the hammer and savagely JAMS the barrel of the pistol into Derek's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the next attack? Who else are you going to kill today, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Oh God... Guzman takes a step towards Colter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more step, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't treat him like this. He's not an animal. Neither are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to him. For God's sake I'm not a terrorist...! A URINE STAIN spreads on Derek's pants. He looks down, ashamed. Colter keeps the gun on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss all you want. You took eighty million dollars to kill hundreds of people today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty million dollars? I swear to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what about the wallet, huh? Why the fuck did you twice try to leave your wallet on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up! What is it?! What is the next attack! So help me, I'll put this bullet through your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to do it. Tightening his finger around the trigger. Tears are streaming down Derek's face. But he's not going to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never hurt anyone. I have a family. I guess you'll have to kill me. But Colter can't. He can't shoot him. He lowers the gun. Disgusted with himself. Why can't he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? You are a human being. Speaking gently. Trying to calm him. Even as Colter feels like he's failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can be worked out. We can listen to each other. The temperature cooling. Derek's nodding with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you want... Please... The detonator CELL PHONE RINGS, startling all of them. Confused, he answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you the guy who was sitting across me on the train? Colter looks at his watch. The countdown passes THREE MINUTES. 2:59... 2:58...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be calling this number?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My friend had it. From when you called her -- to try and get me off the train. Who are you? What do you want? Derek and Guzman cautiously lower their hands. Watching i confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to warn you.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that it matters now.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Talk to me. I feel that something terrible's going to happen. Do I need to get off the train? Am I going to die? He can hear the b.g. noise of the train on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here, okay? Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't I get off the train?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I should have driven in today. But then there's the bridges, right? You never know when they'll be jammed. That stirs something in the back of Colter's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridges. You just never know when they'll be jammed. His heart starts racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the train. Earlier. Derek in his seat, on his cell phone. Colter nearby, overhearing him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, by one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Colter looks to Derek. His stomach sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "By one o'clock, the bridge is going to be jammed." That's what you said. You knew. You knew there was going to be an evacuation. You knew before it happened. All those people walking across the... The realization hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to bomb the bridges. While they're full of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight flicker travels across Derek's face. Like a disturbance on a surface of deep water.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What are you talking about. Who's going to -- Over the phone comes the HORN from the passing FREIGHT TR Colter presses the phone to his ear, trying to hear her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina? Just hang in there. You'll be okay. A HAND closes over his gun. Before Colter can react, Dere

dialogues.speaker: DEREK SHOOTS COLTER TWICE IN THE CHEST.
dialogues.text: Colter staggers back -- slumps to his knees. Guzman cries out -- makes a run at Derek -- who spins and --

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTS GUZMAN DEAD.
dialogues.text: Spent shell casings roll to a stop on the tile floor. A terrible silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's happening? Are you okay? Are you there? Derek picks up the phone and terminates the call. He cold evaluates the two men dying in pools of blood. Then calml walks out. As the life slips from Colter's eyes, he manages to focus his beeping WATCH -- Where the seventeen minutes have RUN OUT. And the world BLEACHES WHITE... In the haze comes the mystical vision again -- but deeper THE STONE WALL now curves over our heads, becoming a TUNN CHRISTINA walks away from us -- down into the tunnel. The far end is ablaze in WHITE LIGHT. We try calling to her. But our voice is weak and faint. S continues towards the light... and we do not follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitor is dark. Everything is still. Colter in his seat. For long seconds we watch his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jarring transition. We are now away from Colter's P.O.V and in the real, physical environment of the Source Code operations center. Military and civilian personnel work a mysterious scientific equipment.
Rutledge talks on a wall phone. Like a team player servin his country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... We appreciate that... I just hope the information has come in time to clear the bridges... Thank you, sir. When he hangs up, he turns to Goodwin and a few other TECHNICIANS. Naked ambition courses through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether or not they can stop the bridge attack, we came up with the intelligence. And that virtually assures all of our futures. This is just the beginning, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a great job, Goodwin. You operated our captain with skill and professionalism. What's that you have? Goodwin opens an envelope and slides out a CITATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army investigated Colter's helicopter crash in Iraq. Apparently he stayed behind to fly protective cover for a disabled convoy until he ran out of fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this, then? Some kind of posthumous reprimand for reckless flying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's the Silver Star. Something in Goodwin's voice momentarily checks Rutledge' breezy good humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it on to his father. It'll ease the pain of his son's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might inform the captain of the citation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not. We can't risk acquainting him with the citation in case the memory wipe isn't entirely clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The memory wipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to let him die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. But now the Director of National Intelligence is sure to want a closer look at our program, and until we train up another candidate, we'll need to keep Colter around to demonstrate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing is much bigger than any one of us. Goodwin, please clear Colter's memories and re-initialize Source Code. Rutledge walks away. The technician gives Goodwin a look disgust. Goodwin carefully replaces the citation into the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission Control. Panels, consoles and screens. Goodwin takes a seat at his workstation. He swings a microphone u and goes to flip a switch. Then stops. Unsure how to proceed. Looks down at the envelope with the citation in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the capsule, the silence continues. Colter thinks himself. The MONITOR then comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, this is Beleaguered Castle. Acknowledge transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge walks by himself. Reflecting. Pleased with himself. Under his breath, he acknowledges the praises he imagining in his head:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir... I appreciate your faith in me... It's a great day for our country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter looks out at Goodwin. A beat of difficult silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling? Are you comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. I knew they wouldn't let me die. At least you can make me forget all of this. I hope. Goodwin stares at his hands. Unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? You're just doing your job. I'd do the same thing if I was you. At least you've got a shot at saving those people on the bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think they'll save them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I meant, I doubt you'd be doing this, if you were me. An unusually personal statement, coming from Goodwin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, someone had to be where you're sitting, and someone had to be in here. Turned out it was you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see Christina again? One last time? Colter's not sure he heard him right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen minutes. That's all I could give you. No mission to fulfill. Just... the two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a favor. One prisoner to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. About me. And about Source Code. We've kept too much from each other. An odd sensation comes over Colter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually report in at 0600. Today I was there early. I was there when the call came in. Your call. His call? They share a long look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... There's no way... There's no way you could have... Goodwin just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? The Source Code was a parallel world! You told me so! It's hermetically sealed. Nothing I did on that train would have any effect on this reality!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were on the train. I was not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't know if any bleed- throughs could occur. The implications would be staggering. That's why you were told to avoid unduly influencing events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying I could have saved those people?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not in our world. The time currents are too strong. But minor alterations, here and there, a phone call, say, those might slip through. We didn't know for sure. But you proved it. Colter is thunderstruck. Unable to grasp it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about the things you said on that call. As the day passed, the more I understood them. And now, I guess we've caught up to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. Just when I think I understand this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much time. They think I'm re-initializing the system. One last look at her. That's all I can give you. If that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll nail your ass for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had any feelings, I'd worry about that. But, as you've maintained, I do not. The strange path of their relationship. Ending at last at simple, grudging respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. MACHINERY BEGINS TO HUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Beleaguered Castle signing off. Acknowledge final transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final transmission acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Goodwin. Goodwin interrupts his preparation for a last look at Col The noise gets louder. The capsule begins to shake. Colter touches the monitor. His fingers imparting to the last image of his world a quiet benediction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sipping a cup of coffee, Rutledge lingers at a window, contemplating his future.

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Dr. Rutledge, extension 16. Blinking out of reverie, he goes over to a wall phone and punches an extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rutledge. He listens. His face darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. He SLAMS down the phone and starts RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter is back on the train. It is morning again, sevente minutes before the destruction. He's back in the navy blazer. The slacks. The commuters, caught up in their individual concerns, ignore Colter. But he looks on them with an appreciation approaching joy. For a moment he just sits there. Simply being alive in th world. Attuned to the motion of the train. The sun on his face. And across from him, oblivious, working away on her sketch pad, is Christina. The best sight of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of MACHINERY are RUNNING. Rutledge comes charging i Flustered. Barking questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Who authorized this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know, sir. But Source Code is up and running again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Goodwin? The chair at the console is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea, sir. A DIGITAL CLOCK ticks down from 17 minutes: 15:28... 15:2 15:26...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter drinks in the sight of Christina. Finally he gets and walks off down the aisle. As soon as he's gone, Christina looks up. She's observed interest in her. Doesn't quite know what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter is by himself in the exit door area. From his jack he takes out a CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he dials 9-1-1. The call connecting...

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 9-1-1. What is the nature of your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge watches the computers churn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut down the Source Code. Right now. The technician hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: RUTLEDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll do it myself. Rutledge sits down at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that. Rutledge gives a dismissive snort. And yet he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've never interrupted Source Code in mid run. We'd have to literally pull the plug. It could damage the processors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it finish, then. No harm in that, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you are in deep shit, I promise you. As for Goodwin, he'll never make it off this base. Rutledge picks up a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's where he's headed. Rutledge considers. And then catches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't. Looks up at the technician. Grows more and more uneasy. Snapping his attention back to

dialogues.speaker: THE COUNTDOWN CLOCK
dialogues.text: Which reads: 12:42. Before it hits 12:41, Rutledge is already out of his chair and RUNNING for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal the ICU. I want a detachment of MPs meeting me on the way there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colter walks down the aisle. Looks at HIS WATCH -- 12 minutes, 40 seconds. The train begins to SLOW DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now approaching Newark Station. Newark Station, next stop. The Computer Engineer begins to wake up. As he does, Colt passes by, deftly slipping the borrowed cell phone back i the engineer's hand without being noticed. Derek packs up his things. We see him hide his wallet int gap in the seat cushions and get up.
The College Kid, also getting up, notices Derek's wallet, picks it up and hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you dropped this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Thanks. Keeping his composure, Derek accepts the wallet. Colter steps aside, allowing them to pass. Allowing it al to happen. The station slides into view. No one on the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge furiously descends, shoving people out of his wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge runs up to a locked door and swipes his access c through the scanner. It comes up RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! He tries again. Red. The door stays LOCKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train comes to a halt. Unlike before, the doors stay shut for SEVERAL SECONDS LONGER than usual. Derek waits quietly at the doors. Finally they open. Derek steps out onto the platform, together with the Old Man, the College Kid and Guzman.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Newark Station. Colter remains on board, standing in the exit area, watch As usual, Derek quickly flips his wallet onto the next ca and starts toward the station house. Guzman is ahead of h already pushing open the doors to the station. All is quiet. Perhaps too quiet. Derek approaches the station and sees

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE OPEN DOORS
dialogues.text: In station lobby are POLICE OFFICERS. Derek's jaw tightens. He changes course, heading instead an outdoor stairwell. Coming UP the stairs, however, are more POLICE OFFICERS. Wheeling around, Derek heads the other way. Walking faste but keeping his head. Not running, not panicking. The train, oddly, is still sitting there. As he nears the other end of the platform, MORE OFFICERS appear from behind columns, cutting off his escape. The police are coming from all sides, converging on the platf Yet no one panics. No one runs. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek Frost. Derek goes to get back on the train. The doors, however, SLIDE SHUT in his face. Through the closed doors, Derek looks in at Colter, still on the train. They stare at one another through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Frost. Please turn to face us. An entire PHALANX OF POLICE OFFICERS is on the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. What's this about? Unseen by the officers, Derek has taken out his CELL PHON and is DIALING IT as he turns around. The police approach, cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place your hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure. Raising his hands, he pushes SEND on his phone. On board the train there's a RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DETONATOR PHONE has been removed from the bomb and no rings harmlessly in the hand of the train's SECURITY OFFI The restroom door is open and swarming with conductors examining the bomb. On the platform, the officers tackle Derek, subduing him. Passengers watch at the windows, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once again, please return to your seats, ladies and gentlemen. No way. No one's moving from the windows. Except for Colter, who stands off by himself. The first l of satisfaction we've ever seen on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM is going off. At a locked door, an Air Force LOCKSMITH is in the process of disabling the key pad. Rutledge paces, livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know who reprogrammed this lock. And if you don't get this open in ten seconds I'll see that you're busted back down to private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already a private, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open it! A man's life is at stake. The key pad goes GREEN and the pressure lock releases. Rutledge tears open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed MILITARY POLICE clatter down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodwin enters. He locks another door behind him. He is shaken but nevertheless going forward. In the chamber, th MEDICS monitor gauges and screens. One of them stands up block his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I can't let you pass. Goodwin removes the patch on his uniform to reveal the insignia of a major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside. That's an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know your rank, Goodwin, but I have explicit orders from Rutledge not to -- BAM! Goodwin drops the Medic with a splintering HEADBUTT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you know my rank. Were you also aware I'm in the Special Forces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train has been evacuated as police investigators sear the rest of the cars. Hoards of passengers fill the platf as conductors try to herd them towards the station.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, rail service has been cancelled. Please clear the platform and proceed into the station. New Jersey Transit apologizes for the inconvenience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police cars parked everywhere. Two DETECTIVES are questioning the Computer Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you have no idea how your cell phone was used to call in the tip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! People mill about waiting for the buses, groaning and complaining. Christina accosts a passing transit employee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? How do we get to work? You guys have some busses or something? The transit employee ignores her and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I'm talking to you! She stands there in exasperation. This whole thing has be designed to thwart her. Nearby, Colter sits on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't life grand? Looking over, she notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now I'm going get fired for being late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's a good thing. She gives him a sharp look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutledge runs, now leading the detachment of MPs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him if you have to, you hear me? The MPs exchange a look of annoyance at being ordered aro by this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy INNER DOOR has been opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEEPING of life support systems. The compressions of ventilator. Goodwin approaches a GURNEY. A jungle of tube and lines lead from the gurney into advanced machinery. A somber look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Captain. As Goodwin edges forward, we reveal the bare foot of some lying there. A DIGITAL TIMER reads 1 MINUTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the facility's outer door, the locksmith goes to work another panel as Rutledge and the MPs stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it ten. Rutledge looks at HIS WATCH. It reads 52 SECONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It also reads 52 seconds. His work is done. He's saved her. Saved them all. At leas this one time. Only she doesn't know that. Christina stands there, arms crossed, scowling at the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could this day get any worse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That train was taking you to a place you didn't want to be. But then you got off. And maybe that's a sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. If only. She takes out her cell phone. The stress of her day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling a cab. Maybe I'll only be somewhat late for work. Colter watches her, a quiet ache inside. Maybe some peopl don't want to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise from the outer door grows louder. The MPs are o seconds from getting inside. Goodman moves towards the li support equipment. As he does, we glimpse a horrifying sight: the upper half Colter's body -- his real body -- inside a sterile tent o transparent plastic. His skull has been removed. A massiv apparatus has been infused directly onto his brain. Goodwin takes a long, last look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your service. Time to go home. Goodwin's hand goes to the switch to shut off life suppor His eyes on the clock. It reads 30 SECONDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina on the phone, waiting as it dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. She turns. Colter gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do anything you want with your life. Starting right now. She's taken aback. He starts walking off.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Metro Cab Dispatch. A long beat as she watches him.

dialogues.speaker: CAB DISPATCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello...? Click. She shuts her phone. Beat. Is she crazy? She's baffled by her own action. And by this unusual guy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Colter turns. She crosses her arms archly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just expect someone to change her life just like that. At the very least... you'd have to buy that person coffee and explain your reasons. She waits for his response. Uneasy at putting herself out there. Colter's watch ticks down to the final seconds. His last moments in this world. He has only time enough for a fina look of reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe some other time. Disappointment flickers on her face. She turns to go. Behind her is a STONE WALL. A BICYCLE is parked against i Colter's breath catches in his throat. This is it! This i the mysterious scene he's been seeing! HIS WATCH - Hits ZERO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DIGITAL TIMER - Also hits ZERO. The outer door OPENS. Rutledge RUSHES in, accompanied by MPs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest him! Goodwin backs away from the gurney, hands in the air. The BEEPING has given way to a MONOTONE. All of Colter's vital signs have FLATLINED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dying...! Rutledge frantically goes to reconnect the machines -- bu Goodwin has turned off too many of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a medical team in here! Move! But the MPs just stare at the appalling sight of Colter's exposed brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you standing there for?! Do it! We can save him!!! No one moves. Rutledge rashly grabs for one of the MP's rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess force is the only thing you people understa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back away, sir, now! The MP has leveled his rifle at Rutledge. Who steps back, aghast. His authority has vanished with Colter's life. Goodwin shuts off the monitors. Silence fills the room. Colter is dead. Rutledge stares sorrowfully at Colter's body. Then at Goodwin with burning hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a murderer. Goodwin offers his hands to the MP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and arrest me. But the MP does nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be around. Whenever you want me. They part as he walks out of the room. A look of grim satisfaction on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christina walks past the bicycle parked against the stone wall. She's about to enter a TUNNEL that goes under the tracks. The same tunnel from Colter's vision. She stops. Something tells her to turn around. The bench where Colter sat is empty. But three feet away... Colter is standing there. Still he Dumbfounded, he looks at his watch -- it remains at ZERO. He looks all around. Trees stirring in the breeze. A bird flies overhead. The crowd of passengers outside the stati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Colter turns to her. How can this be? He's afraid to even speak. As if that alone could break the enchantment. But the world is here. It goes on. That's all he knows. Finally he swallows. Finding his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. The least I can do is buy you coffee. This pleases Christina, although she tries not to show it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, come on then. Walking forward, he joins her. The two of them disappear down the tunnel. A beautiful morning. FADE OUT.
